name: Black Bulbul
description: It has an overall black or gray-black coloration. The nominate subspecies H. l. leucocephalus features a white head, orange beak, and orange legs. Other subspecies may be entirely black.
image_alt: Black bulbul, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
reproduction: Females lay 2–3 eggs; incubation duration in the wild is unknown.
attractions: It is rather solitary, staying alone or in pairs, though it tolerates the presence of other bulbul species.
breeding: We have kept black bulbuls since 2004 and successfully bred them.
